_header: First when a man or woman drinks more
_description: ‘Augustinus de peccatis venialibus’, extracted from The Pricke of Conscience — twenty-seven couplets

CamTCC1144.First Lines:
ffyrst whan a man or a woman drynkes moreEny tyme here then myster
                    wore…
CamTCC1144.Last Lines:
…Thorwght thowte or ded or speche in vaynAnd yche a syn ys
                    worthy peyn
CamTCC1144.Editions:
Person,  Henry Axel. 
             Cambridge Middle English Lyrics.
         Seattle: University of Washington Press, 1953; rev. ed. 1962: 22-3.
